website_summaries.verdict: The Plustek OpticFilm 8200i Ai film scanner offers high resolution, hardware-based dust and scratch removal, and simple color calibration for scans.
pros: Optical resolution rated at 7,200 pixels per inch
cons: Scans only one slide or frame of film at a time

customer_reviews.title: the most user  unfriendly software I have ever met
customer_reviews.text: after over 100 attempts I was unable to obtain a full scan of any slide. this is a shame because the machine itself is super quality and the limited partial scan I did obtain was also great quality this is not for the man in the street. it is really aimed at the professionals.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hugely disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Two of us have spent the best part of two days trying to make this scanner work. We are fairly confident IT users. Software would not install properly on either a pc or mac. On the pc the software kept on closing down. On the mac we didn't even get that far.... got a message saying the licence was out of date. Very, very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: The Dutchman

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality scanner...takes practice though!
customer_reviews.text: Spent a lot of time deciding which scanner to buy and quite pleased with this one. Easy enough to use BUT the Silverfast software is very difficult to use with Mac - so I invested in Vuescan which is much much easier to use and very effective. Is this scanner worth the money? In terms of scan quality yes but I cannot figure out how to use it with my Mac without using the Vuesan software (Quickscan and IntelliScan buttons)
customer_reviews.author: Joe W

customer_reviews.title: Best product for the money
customer_reviews.text: This photo i scanned from the negative was 40 years old and scratched . Great product 6 stars even , you need to update software when you first get it but after that it took me about 2 days to get use to the silverfast software but then i got some really really good results . Never dine nothing like this before and as you can see from my pic that i have achieved amazing results
customer_reviews.author: Steviejacko

customer_reviews.title: The Best One Out There
customer_reviews.text: This is a professional and very clever piece of technology. It has transformed old slides into high resolution digital images. I have worked through over 3000 slides, and this hasn't faulted once. Highly recommend for the enthusiastic photo restorer. I researched for many months, reading many reviews and asking fellow photographers what was best, and this came out tip each time. Their technology support team is also very patient and offer great advice.
customer_reviews.author: VitalBearHealth

customer_reviews.title: Plustek 35mm Film Scanner
customer_reviews.text: I had a Minalta Dimage Scan Elite 5400 which failed after years of service. The Plustek 8200i SE replaced it. Far more facilities and options. I have scanned 50 out of my remaining 4,500 photos. The Plustek is brilliant. Fully recommended for anyone who has negative and slides required to be digitized. I can not comment on the companies Technical Support as I have not contacted them. The Silverfast 8 Instruction booklet is very good and easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Chris Young

customer_reviews.title: Cannot recommend this product highly enough
customer_reviews.text: Cannot recommend this product highly enough. Scanned 35mm images are sharp and extremely well rendered. Use the 'professional' mode of scanning and tweak for 3600ppi, if necessary select the appropriate film manufacturer filter. Results are astounding and would certainly hold up comparably well alongside 24Mpixel digital cameras when 50 or 100 ISO slide film is used.
customer_reviews.author: DR TIMOTHY B LITTLER

customer_reviews.title: The device was reasonably easy to install, but I needed some technical advice re s/w and system.
customer_reviews.text: What I disliked most was that the device was supplied with a two pin round mains connector, to use with UK 13 amp rectangular sockets. The adaptor that was supplied had no instructions with it as to how to remove the two pin component and attached the three pin adaptor component without causing damage to the connector or oneself. I am using the device to digitise / scan a range of different types of quite old 35 mm slides and colour negative films and produce a digital file for each old slide.
customer_reviews.author: Devotee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent if you have a lot of old negatives to scan
customer_reviews.text: I had a box of old family photo negatives to scan and this gave better results than the Epson V550. The provided trays/holders fit slides and 35mm negatives. I had a lot of 110 and 126 negatives from the 60s and 70s but was able to order custom made 110 and 126 negative holders to fit this scanner online from a specialised supplier in USA. It scanned these without a problem. Image quality is great. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Sculptor1

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Very good for scanning negatives, especially (in fact preferably) using Ed Hamrick's Vuescan. I have never rated Silverfast and rather object to having to pay for it as part of the package! Paul Warner FRPS
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P. J. Warner

customer_reviews.title: Serious quality problems
customer_reviews.text: Two defective scanners , one after the other. There is a serious quality problem with this manufacturer. I will be returning the second duff one to Amazon shortly.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B. C. Lord

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit sceptical about this product, however I gave it a try. It was easy to install. Essential part is state-of-the-art scanning software (SilverFast8SE) which comes in the bundle (standalone price was 50+ Euros) and that was main reason why to choose Plustek. Thanks to available on-line video guides learning curve is steep, it takes about an hour to figure out how to optimise scanning process. Quality of scanned images could be compared to images taken by digital camera. Software will remove majority of dust and scratches. On some negatives a distinctive horizontal trace was visible during scanning, I would root this to film developing machine. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: PC user

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use scanner that creates 2400dpi (or more) JPG files to get your old photos viewed again!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product as I have LARGE PLASTIC STORAGE BOXES full of 35mm photos & negatives that never see the light of day. This device creates approx. 2mb JPG files @ 2400dpi that are more than adequate for my general needs (takes 50-55 seconds to scan a negative) and, if required, I can up the resolution to 7200dpi for A3 sized prints!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing detail
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up with very capable bundled software though it needs a bit of time to learn how to get the bbest from it. Capable of scanning at very high levels of detail but this can produce huge file sizes of 100mb or more if you get the settings wrong. Reducing the scnning resolution makes them smaller - often without compromising quality - and makes the scanning process much faster. I only wish it would move from one to the next in the strip without manual intervention.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Small in size, does not take up much room.
customer_reviews.text: You will need paid for app to use this scanner. And it will prove to be an added expense. Full access to all features not availiable until app purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Buccaneer

customer_reviews.title: A really mixed bag!
customer_reviews.text: The scanner works really well but it is supplied with SilverFast software that so far despite trying half a dozen times it will not install on my iMac. It gets hung up and will not complete the installation. I am awaiting a call back from SilverFast.
customer_reviews.author: Jestyn

customer_reviews.title: Revitalise old pictures or embrace the world of film photography
customer_reviews.text: After much research and having used an old Minolta Dimage film scanner with Windows XP and a scsi card the time was ripe to pick something that would work with USB and Mac OSX 10.8. This scanner suits the task admirably and is in constant use. The supplied software silverfast 8 is quite complex to use with many options, I downloaded vuescan as an alternative and tend to use this more often unless I need a particular film profile which silverfast has. An extra pair of film/slide holders is a must if you need to scan a couple of rolls of film on a Sunday afternoon so bear this in mind when purchasing. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Helpful Martin

customer_reviews.title: Clunky software
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only been using this scanner for a couple of days now but two things stick out for me. Firstly the software. Like many other reviews, the software is a pain. It’s dated, clunky and ugly! Secondly the tech support is at best; dreadful. I haven’t contacted LaserSoft personally but I’ve ready quite a few help forums. They are rude, arrogant and condescending to the users that are trying to find out answers and people who try to suggest change. The quality of the scans are good and what you’d expect from a £200 film scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Rupert Hennen

customer_reviews.title: A precision product giving good results
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are quite detailed for making changes to the scan I found the quick scan the best as the adjustments were made by the software automatically speeding up the process but it is important the slides are dust and dirt free
customer_reviews.author: c corney

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner let down by the bundled software
customer_reviews.text: As has been said before, Silverfast is buggy and complicated. You can spend 4 hours trying to get it to work followed by a trip to the online store for hair restorer, or you can budget the extra £20 and get Vuescan. This works and is simple to use. I am particually delighted with the infrared dust and fungus clean up function. Saves a monumental job on photoshop. If you are scanning deteriorating old slides dont even think of skimping on the extra for this function
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Works really well and the latest version of Silverfast (8) is pretty robust and has good video tutorials
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to digitise an archive of family 35mm slides going back to the 1950s. Works really well and the latest version of Silverfast (8) is pretty robust and has good video tutorials. Worth investing time to learn how to use the software as results, especially on old faded slides can be dramatically improved. Learning and experimenting should only take an hour. Feels a bit complex to begin with but soon becomes intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Parker Smith

customer_reviews.title: I like it, but......
customer_reviews.text: I've given 4 stars because the scanner is very well built and appears to work well. However, like previous reviewer Tipo901 I think the supplied software, Silverfast, is not good at all. No doubt it could produce excellent results but it is very difficult to understand. I, too, tried the demo version of Vuescan and produced much better results without reference to any manual or help files. It's a shame you can't buy the scanner on it's own and use your own software.
customer_reviews.author: albol

customer_reviews.title: produces great images
customer_reviews.text: I am using this to digitise a large family collection of old negatives and slides. It has worked flawlessly and the software repairs damaged images very well. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: sherlock

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant slide scanner
customer_reviews.text: Top quality scans. Software works fine on my iMac. Dust removal with infrared scan is first rate; saves me hours in Photoshop. Cannot fault it.
customer_reviews.author: Godrevygirl

customer_reviews.title: Plustek Optic Film 8200i Film Scanner
customer_reviews.text: This is a first rate scanner for 35mm slides and film. I am very pleased with the results of the slides I have copied into my computer. Kids have made quite a lot of 10 x 15 prints which look good to me even though only fairly low dpi. Still many slides to do and then negative colour fil of which I have even more to scan. I know it seems expensive but if you want good copies it is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: G. COBBING

customer_reviews.title: Film Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Overall very impressed at both the speed of delivery and the quality of the actual product. Software installation was accomplished very quickly with no problems. The scanned image quality is very impressive, provided the slide being scanned is a reasonable quality. The downside being that the provided software does accept images that are very dark (other reviewers of this product I notice have the same opinions regarding this issue)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations - and Amazon Prime's service is top notch
customer_reviews.text: The quality is beyond my expectations for the price, and I don't know how people complain about the software not being intuitive - after just a quick read of the manual, all the functionalities are really clear and effective. Will definitely consider Plustek again if I'll need to upgrade this scanner (this one doesn't do 120). Got it with Amazon Prime trial - the service really is excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Gabriele Correddu

customer_reviews.title: BUT miles better (in a different league) than a Max Spielmann photo ...
customer_reviews.text: Images not as sharp as I imagined. Prints looked sharper than the scans, but after flatbed scanning the prints at 600dpi and comparing to a negative scan at 3200dpi from the 8100, they are about the same. Probably ok for the money, but don't expect razor sharp scans when viewed at 1:1 on screen. BUT miles better (in a different league) than a Max Spielmann photo CD scanned from the same negatives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can be made to work with Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: The scanner works well if you can get the driver accepted by Windows. Try all I can I can't get it to work with Windows 10. Have used it with another PC on Windows 7. Takes a while to learn all the intricacies of the Silver fast software. Since writing the above I have downloaded the latest PlusTek 8100 64bit driver and the scanner is now working with Windows 10
customer_reviews.author: Eric Benton

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner but software issues.
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant film scanner at a very competitive price. The software can be a little tricky and it stopped working but I was able to find an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: L. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Scan it get better?
customer_reviews.text: This product does exactly what it says on the tin,it scans slides and negatives so that they can be imported onto a computer, Mac or PC — the results are impressive and the sharp (given the slides and negatives I have scanned are a bit grainy). I am very impressed with the results and pleased the with product. It is performing well and allowing me to recover my old photographs as an excellent resolution.
customer_reviews.author: The Mouse

customer_reviews.title: Good Product Poor Software
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surpised at the build quality of this item - it was actually much better than I expected. Scans are accurate and detailed. Just remember it only scans negatives and slides and only 35mm ones at that. The silverfast software provided is however a complete nightmare to use and to learn - & the alternate Plustek software is very dated and very basic. I eventually gave up and got a copy of Vuescan which is easy to use and gave very good results.
customer_reviews.author: Mini-Me

customer_reviews.title: complicated and not easily accessed
customer_reviews.text: Faulty product but supplier did his best and it was finally returned and my money refunded.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. M. J.

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but not easy to get going
customer_reviews.text: A good product that does what it says. However, the supporting documents to get it going left me floundering at times, but I eventually found a phone number that provided assistance. Once I got the hang of it, I used some of the very flexible software applications, that seemed to bring out the best in the photos.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Film Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Working well sofar, some problems initially finding driver for Windows 10, but found one on SilverFast site. Works well on iMac too.
customer_reviews.author: Janis Horley

customer_reviews.title: Great once you have mastered it...
customer_reviews.text: As with a lot of other reviews, the software does take a bit of fiddling to get to an acceptable level but once I was past that point, I have been pretty pleased with the results. I am scanning slides over 30 years old and they are looking good once digitised. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Phil P.

customer_reviews.title: Silverlight makes a huge difference
customer_reviews.text: Once installed (Windows 10) it has proven to be a very good scanner and the Silverlight makes a huge difference. With some jiggery-pokery I have been able to scan 110 and 126 negative strips, too.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. S. Hooper

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality scans, make final adjustments later in Photoshop or Keynote
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use in the more or less "automatic" mode. Adjustments are very difficult to make using the provided software, so it is best to scan in a high resolution following the recommended "flow" and then make adjustment afterword in Photoshop or Keynote.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. S. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent high quality scanner, having to pay extra for software not so good.
customer_reviews.author: Mr D Hall

customer_reviews.title: It's a good scanner, but it was quite a job getting ...
customer_reviews.text: Was defeated by the Silverlight software. Had to get a tech to install it for me. It's a good scanner, but it was quite a job getting it up and running.
customer_reviews.author: bigreader

customer_reviews.title: Thoughtful Product
customer_reviews.text: Everything from packaging to operation to software has been done for the benefit of the customer . The end product however rests with the operator . Knowledge and practice required .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: better than I expected, even the 7200 resolution is better than the 3600, usually not the case for devices. Slow but worth it, quality always takes time. Take the time to dust the negs and slides.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the scanner now it is up and running
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the scanner now it is up and running. However anyone wanting to use it with a mac needs to be aware that the software provided is not compatible with OS I Capitan. Do not download the suggested drivers. Once the software has been installed you need to purchase an upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: The unit is compact and sturdy quality. Quite impressive if a bit slow
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Plustek 8200 film Scanner
customer_reviews.text: My husband has loads of old photos and slides which he keeps scanning and printing, and he is absolutely delighted with this product. He had an earlier cheaper model of plustek previously which he was happy with, but after it broke he chose this one and is very happy with his choice, though it did take a bit of getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: L Shearing

customer_reviews.title: Has done a fantastic job in digitalizing our old family slides and colour ...
customer_reviews.text: Has done a fantastic job in digitalizing our old family slides and colour positives. Really impressed with the dust and scratch correction!
customer_reviews.author: Ian Moore

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this device!
customer_reviews.text: What a great piece of kit! Still tweaking the settings to get the very best out of it, but at last I can scan my neg collection and start making use of my photographs!
customer_reviews.author: T. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy scanner
customer_reviews.text: There is insufficient information on installing the software for this product and my husband spent many hours trying to get it installed properly. After some considerable time he managed to get it all to work. We didn't contact the supplier as others mentioned in their reviews that they had found them unhelpful. It was worth persevering.
customer_reviews.author: S M

customer_reviews.title: film scanner
customer_reviews.text: The scanner is not top notch but is great value for money, the software is a bit complicated for me. The dust removal is good but I don't think as impressive as ICE that I have on an Epson flatbed. Overall would recommend as value for money if you only have a few hundred images to do then you probably won't do any more.
customer_reviews.author: MR D MCALONE

customer_reviews.title: Great !
customer_reviews.text: Very good scanner. It's quite hard to beat quality. I've been also using Flextight and quality is a bit better of course but most of cases plustek will do the job. Much much better than flat bed skanners. Wish to have medium format plustek in a bit better price.
customer_reviews.author: Piotr

customer_reviews.title: No help from customer service
customer_reviews.text: It is possible that it does work. After one month it is still not working, despite several calls to the customer service, who are just not interested. Now looking for something that will do the job that this clearly does not.
customer_reviews.author: Wren

customer_reviews.title: Worked well and allowed me to finally digitise all the ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked well and allowed me to finally digitise all the old negatives that I had (going as far back as a Kodak Instamatic!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Gray

customer_reviews.title: rubbish software.
customer_reviews.text: if you want to waste days of your life wrestling with totally rubbish software and getting nowhere this is the product for you. Its going back!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pro scans
customer_reviews.text: Serious bit of kit and you will be rewarded with precise scans, it take a while though so if in a hurry go cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: GroovyJohn

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this purchase. This is the second model in this range that I've owned. Is an upgrade on my previous machine and I'm not disappointed either with the hardware or Silverfast software.
customer_reviews.author: CornishExile

customer_reviews.title: Fine
customer_reviews.text: Third such scanner we have, do a better job than flatbed scanners scanning 35mm film. No rating for technical support because we have never used it
customer_reviews.author: Anthony B.

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: Works very well if you do not use all of the automatic processing. Turn it all off and just do the basic scan with dust and scratch removal. Some slides it does not do well but these are few and far between. I've used it with Kodachrome, Ektachrome and Fuji and Velvia all are scanned fine. Get the extra film holder set - it improves productivity.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Roger W. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Plustek OpticFilm8200iSE Film Scanne
customer_reviews.text: Cracking bit of kit worth the money.Get Vuescan software it make scanning so easy
customer_reviews.author: M. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use ... but disappointing output
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to use, but picture quality was disappointing and not at a high enough quality to use professionally.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: easy to use, quite time consuming to scan and the software has a steep learning curve. A shame they did not update the driver for the 7500 to cover windows 8.1
customer_reviews.author: gpaige

customer_reviews.title: hard to setup but then easy to use
customer_reviews.text: found it difficult to setup so recommend watching online tutorials. am using at a very basic level and it is working well for me! picture quality is very decent. highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ahana k

customer_reviews.title: ... scanner in the world but given time can produce excellent results.
customer_reviews.text: Not the fastest scanner in the world but given time can produce excellent results.
customer_reviews.author: merlin

customer_reviews.title: It does exactly what it says it will do. ...
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what it says it will do. However, if you have a large number of negatives expect it to take a while.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner very small footprint
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner very small footprint. Silver fast software provided is incredible at bringing all detail available out of negative. Highly recommend. Great service from amazon
customer_reviews.author: Joe Dunne

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Pleased with product This meets my requirements of high quality slide copying. I find it takes about a minute to copy slide
customer_reviews.author: Prof Ronald McG Harden

customer_reviews.title: Film Scan
customer_reviews.text: Great device and easy to set up and run Had no problems and will now be able to scan all my old films
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted, works great and the clarity and resolution is great. took some time to get used to the software supplied with it, but good now.
customer_reviews.author: andrew howson

customer_reviews.title: gooe value for money says what it does
customer_reviews.text: arrived within 24 hours only problem was getting it to run on windows 8 but good response fron tech help
customer_reviews.author: j. tyson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic but slow.
customer_reviews.text: I changed from a Canonscan 8800F to this for my 135 film scanning and I am kicking myself for not making the change earlier! My 135 scans now look much sharper and the look is closer to the 120 scans I get off the Canonscan. The only downside is that you have to manually feed each frame which makes scanning much more of a chore (and takes longer) than with the Canonscan.
customer_reviews.author: JPS

customer_reviews.title: Just the job!
customer_reviews.text: The software loaded easily onto Windows 7 and the user interface is intuative and easy to navigate around. The scanner itself is well made and is quiet during scans. The quality of the finsihed scans is as high as you need and all aspects are controlable. You can even access mini-tutorials at each stage of the scanning process. I found this very helpfull when I first started using it. I definitely recommend you choose the model with infra-red dust and scratch detection and repair - it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: S. G. Whitehead

customer_reviews.title: Slide Film Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Been looking for the right scanner at the right price for ages. Easy to set up and relatively easy to use. Would recommend purchase with Silverfast 8 software as the scanner comes into it's own then. Brilliant if you have old slides that you don't mind spending a little time on when converting to digital. Resolution possibilities can be tailored to your own needs with the software.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Rabbitts

customer_reviews.title: Limited Sharpness and Shortcomings of SilverFast Software
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed that I need to use maximum sharpening to achieve the sharpness of the original. The SilverFast 8 software is difficult to use, and it is difficult to get a good scan from a bad negative or transparency. I often get better results using the Plustek Quickscan. However, the Grain and Noise Elimination option (GANE) works well. When making a scan using SilverFast, I frequently get "Unexpected Error" - about 20% of times normally, or 70% of times when using Multi-Exposure. Fortunately this does not crash the application and it is just necessary to try another scan - sometimes 4 or 5 times for a Multi-exposure!.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: An excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent scanner especially considering the price. Straight out of the box it was simple to activate [I am Mac-based]. The results were terrific. A virtual straight print from the scan [at 2400ppi] of a 40 year old B+W neg was very impressive. I bought one to try out and if suitable will buy more for my A level photgraphy students to use - it is and I will!
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Melton

customer_reviews.title: Plustek OpticFilm8200iAi Film Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Very good machine. A bit slow but the quality of the scans is amazing. Did not expect it that good. The Silverfast software was a bit difficult to install and it stops working sometimes. But all overall I am very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Stuckenberg

customer_reviews.title: Machine is overall not bad, but images need a lot of tweaking afterwards.
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a Konica Minolta Dimage Scan Dual iv. The 8100 isn't really in the same league, but it did cost less. The Silverfast software that comes with the Plustek is a battle and the machine struggles with dark areas in an image, but overall, can give good results with patience.
customer_reviews.author: Rafe Greenacre

customer_reviews.title: To early for accurate assessment
customer_reviews.text: The results so far are reasonably good but not as good as I had hoped. I hope that I will get better results with more experience.
customer_reviews.author: J. E. Holley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the scanner I just need to be more preficiant which will come with practice.
customer_reviews.author: R.B.S.

customer_reviews.title: Now rendered useless
customer_reviews.text: I rated this scanner 5 stars when I bought it. Sadly it is now rendered useless since Mac Os15 (catalina) came in as neither driver nor bundled Siverfast 8 software runs on this Os. I have contacted both Silverfast and Plustek and have received no reassurance from them about updated software being made available. So extreme caution if you have a Mac and are considering this scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Sawbones49

customer_reviews.title: Everything works great, had to buy another AC adapter since UK ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything works great, had to buy another AC adapter since UK adapters don't work in the rest of EU. Also bought Vuescan software since it's more user friendly. All in all great piece of hardware, that will help me preserve 45+ years old memories alive. The fact, that there's no automatism in scanning slides, doesn't bother me at all. I'm quite happy to invest some more time in getting the good "final product".
customer_reviews.author: Andrej S.

customer_reviews.title: Ok for one off scans
customer_reviews.text: The generic software for the scanner is not worth the disk space, but Silver fast is excellent if you are doing only a few scans at a time. I have thousands of negatives to scan and have gone back to my flatbed as it is quicker and excellent quality. Sold a few days after purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unable to load discs.
customer_reviews.text: Programme Discs will not load onto pc. I have emailed Plustek twice and no reply recieved. Currently have £350 worth of unusable product!!! Looking for independent advice to rectify the problem. Poor customer service
customer_reviews.author: Neil Harris

customer_reviews.title: ... given it 5 stars if the bundled software was better. I downloaded vuescan to use with it and ...
customer_reviews.text: Would have given it 5 stars if the bundled software was better. I downloaded vuescan to use with it and find it easier to use and get better results.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Slow - slides have to be manually fed. However quality is very good and the process is fairly straightforward once you get to grips with Silverfast
customer_reviews.author: Anonymouse

customer_reviews.title: Capable of great results. I previously used the Canon 2710 but ...
customer_reviews.text: Capable of great results.I previously used the Canon 2710 but this can give better results.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Watters

customer_reviews.title: ... bought this for my scanning project after deciding the best scanner for this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my scanning project after deciding the best scanner for this work
customer_reviews.author: STEWART GRATRICK

customer_reviews.title: stopped working after half an hour
customer_reviews.text: This seemed to be a pretty good scanner. The software is really bad, but the scanner was coming up with nice scans. Then half an hour into memory lane it started making a loud high-pitched noise and refused to go on. I got twelve scans out of it. Nikon, are you there? Please make film scanners again...
customer_reviews.author: Webster Forrest

customer_reviews.title: Very Dissappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have a 7500i scanner already and like may people suffered from dark images. I ordered this new model as it had a different light source and supposedly the multi-exposure worked better for high contrast and dark images. The images from the 8200i seem to have a narrower dynamic range than the 7500i, images are darker and the ME function is not improved. I returned it to Amazon
customer_reviews.author: romfordbluenose

customer_reviews.title: NOT compatible  with Windows 8.1
customer_reviews.text: When trying to load the Plustek scanner driver in Windows 8.1 an error message appears and the loading of the driver crashes. Plustek support have confirmed that the driver is not compatible with Windows 8.1 and have not got back to me with a date when they will update the driver to make it operate under Windows 8.1. As I couldn't use the scanner I have given it one star.
customer_reviews.author: Iain MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: Good scanner disappointing software
customer_reviews.text: The scanner was fairly straight forward to install however the scanning software does not run properly. No response from software support
customer_reviews.author: sheila howes

customer_reviews.title: 1 star indicates 'I hate this'.
customer_reviews.text: Despite the claims, this scanner is NOT supported by Apple. It will not run with the OSX. I'm now waiting to hear from Plustek about this. 1 star indicates 'I hate this' ... not sure how I can hate something when I can't get it it to work as intended! Personally, I would given it 0 stars as it does not do the job it was built for!
customer_reviews.author: batteryman

customer_reviews.title: Plustek Good, Silverfast Bad
customer_reviews.text: The scanner itself is fine. Does exactly what it says on the tin, and I have 30 years of kodachromes, velvias and negatives of various types to chomp onto the pooter. My missis doesn't quite know what my birthday present was letting her in for - middle-aged-bloke-with-a-computer-widow! Silverfast Ai is frustrating to install. It took an hour of big-red-switches, reboots and retries before the software suddenly found the scanner. Persist with it. The interface is awful, the manual worse, but once mastered it delivers a rich set of features. Important point to note. The colour profiles apply only to negatives - so your velvias will still contain red-faced people basking under purple-tinged skies.
customer_reviews.author: Miles

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Hardware is simple enough to use, but the same can't be said of the software. Plustek's own software is basically useless, whilst the SilverFast 8 software is almost incomprehensible to use - although it does produce better results. I'm now wishing that I'd kept my old Epson Photo flatbed scanner, which produced results at least as good, with far less effort.
customer_reviews.author: KEITH H

customer_reviews.title: Faulty but now replaced by Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scanner because of good reviews of Plustek products and when I received it I thought it was very good until I noticed a narrow, vertical band on all scans. After lots of painful research and trial and error I narrowed it down to a hardware fault. Plustek confirmed this when I contacted them. I returned the scanner to Amazon and their service has been great - a replacement was sent out first-class post and now all appears to be ok. Well done Amazon. Let's hope the scanner proves to be reliable. By all accounts this is one of the best negative scanners out there for the money.
customer_reviews.author: spottiewattie

customer_reviews.title: A waste of money and time
customer_reviews.text: This scanner hasn't worked from day one. Amazon won't except a return and the manufacturer, Plustek, despite the unit being under warranty and registered make no effort to return my calls or emails, to replace, repair, return the unit. It's an expensive piece of kit, which you would expect to work. I can't voice my disappointment enough. Do yourself a favour and avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: will

customer_reviews.title: This scanner appears not work with El Capitan software
customer_reviews.text: I bought a second one of these after I thought the first had broken but it transpires that the change of Apple OS to El Capitan has meant the scanner does not work with Apple software. The scanner people are trying to fix the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Told by manufacturer to shake it for two minutes!
customer_reviews.text: The scanner arrived, but after setting it up I found that it would only scan between 1/3 and 1/2 of the image. I emailed Plustek's support, and this is the reply I got back. I've now requested a refund. Dear Many thanks for supporting Plustek product. Sometimes the scanner stuck during the transport, in this case please shake it well with hand for at least 2 minutes, connected it back to PC & it will work. If it is not working, please take it back to the place you have bought it for repair depending on your warranty. Please if you face any trouble, please feel free to contact us. Kind regards, xxxxx
customer_reviews.author: Mr Ian Seager

customer_reviews.title: Plustek
customer_reviews.text: After struggling with the installation instructions, I found the unit was faulty. It only scanned 2/3rds of the negative. The online help was excellent. I will think twice about purchasing another!.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia B Green

customer_reviews.title: Not sure as yet?
customer_reviews.text: Scanner is OK. Gives large file sizes but the trick is to get the finer settings correct which is a software issue - doesn't seem to like dark / shade areas of a slide, seems to work fine on negatives.
customer_reviews.author: Griff

customer_reviews.title: Crap software which does not work so i had to abandon the scanner and keep with my Flatbed
customer_reviews.text: I had to return it as i could not get the software to load even after several emails with Plustek How hard can it be to make software which just works with windows 7 etc etc Rubbish tbh and buy yourself an epson flat bed which just works no problems ever
customer_reviews.author: MR T.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: The driver software for this scanner does not work with Windows 10 thus rendering the scanner useless. The buttons feel cheap as they don't have a clean movement. I cannot comment on the quality of the scanned images as I could not scan a single negative.
customer_reviews.author: tiggers
